a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of government consumption in GDP vs. share of population living
Extreme poverty is defined as living below the International Poverty Line of $2.15 per day. This data is adjusted for inflation and
for differences in the cost of living between countries.
Share of government consumption in GDP
Data source: Feenstra et al. (2015), Penn World Table (2021); World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform
Note: Poverty data is measured in international-$ at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to either disposable income or
